entry.title: Newsletter #84
entry.content:
#TechThursday time!

Do you really need a desk to code ???

… Just do it!

Lucio’s way

Here is the usual “selection” of links our team found interesting this week , enjoy:

  • Zoom on PHP objects and classes

  • Salary Negotiations: Win by Losing

  • Behat – Page Object Extension

  • Page object pattern

  • Of course it’s difficult…

  • Code As Documentation

  • Active listening

  • Your Tests Are Dragging You Down

  • PHP 7 Infographic – 5 things you need to know

  • Import golang; struct microservice – Codemotion Rome 2015

  • Stop using tail -f (mostly)

  • node-objectify: convert a list of objects into an object

  • Acceptance tests for a CDN

  • Why do some developers at strong companies like Google consider Agile development to be nonsense?

  • The StackExchange architecture and its performance

  • Still one of my favourite hacks: Dublin Bus timetable boards use a Japanese あ character to denote disabled access

  • HTML code news sites use for tragedies like Germanwings Flight 4U 9525

  • redis trivia

  • Redis 3.0.0 is closer

  • Google rebrands and launches brand new platform

  • Go interfaces communicate intent

  • Shrinking Docker Images

  • The Realities of Docker in Production

  • What Every Open Source Project Needs

  • Docker security: making sure you get it right

  • A Beginner’s Guide to HTTP and REST

  • Why you should not use AngularJS

  • What I would recommend instead of Angular.js?

  • A Monad in Practicality: First-Class Failures

  • Simplifying the ES6 Workflow with JSPM

  • Osmosis

  • Functional UI and Components as Higher Order Functions

  • Test Your API With Supertest

  • Loading CSS without blocking render

  • A General Theory of Reactivity

  • ng-wat And The Story Behind It

  • Docker in production

  • Stop using tail (mostly)

  • Golang and microservices

  • Kibana 4 – the beer analytics engine

  • Insecure default in Elasticsearch enables remote code execution

  • How to format Python code without really trying

  • Rearchitecting Spark for Mobile Platforms
